info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 1:30AM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
info.description:
At 130 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles east of Comstock to 6 miles southwest of Amistad Village. Movement was east at 20 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible.
Locations impacted include... Del Rio, Comstock, Lake View, Amistad Acres, Laughlin AFB, Cienegas Terrace, Amistad Village, Black Brush Point, Box Canyon, Val Verde Park, Diablo East, Governors Landing, Long Point, 277 South Boat Ramp, 277 North Campground, Rough Canyon Recreation Area, Spur 406 Campground, Rock Quarry Campground, Escondido Estates, and Salem Point.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.
A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 AM CDT for south central Texas.
